pr_title: chore: dont list all topics to determine single topic existence (MINOR)

timeline.message: chore: dont list all topics to determine single topic existence

timeline.bodyText: If they're not authorized, it returns false.  Was this the behavior of listTopicNames that it returned a list of only the topics for which they are authorized?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: that's what i assumed, but I've removed this because after local testing it looks like it will actually throw a UnknownTopicException if you don't have view access so I'll leave it to propegate the error in this case
replies.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand the reasoning for returning false here. We don't know if the topic exists or not at this point right?
timeline.author: rodesai

replies.bodyText: I'll double check @AlanConfluent's comment, but my intuition was that if you're not authorized to describe a topic it's not going to show up on list topics. This is usually what I've seen in other services, I get a 404 if I'm not using the right credentials, not a 403.
replies.author: agavra

replies.bodyText: After further inspection, I'll remove this check and just let it propegate. It looks like if you try to describe a topic you don't have permissions for it just throws the epxected UnknownTopicOrPartitionException
replies.author: agavra
